intro: Strobilanthes phyllocaulos, commonly known as the leaf-cup strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure. The plant features striking, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies.
